nodes.name: project
nodes.description: Any specifically defined piece of work that is undertaken or attempted to meet a single requirement. This can be a JCOIN study project, a project consisting of collection of files from a  specific repository or source, or a collaborative project etc.

properties.name: availability_type
properties.description: Is the project open or restricted?

properties.name: code
properties.description: Unique identifier for the project.

properties.name: dbgap_accession_number
properties.description: The dbgap accession number provided for the project.

properties.name: intended_release_date
properties.description: Tracks a Project's intended release date.

properties.name: name
properties.description: Display name/brief description for the project.

properties.name: protocol
properties.description: If a JCOIN hub study, the category of study as defined by Ducharme et al., 2021. Journal of Substance Abuse Treatment publication.

properties.name: releasable
properties.description: A project can only be released by the user when `releasable` is true.

properties.name: released
properties.description: To release a project is to tell the GDC to include all submitted entities in the next GDC index.

properties.name: project.id
properties.description: A unique identifier for records in this 'project' table.

nodes.name: participant
nodes.description: The collection of all data related to a specific client (participant) or other individuals with data (eg., staff) in the context of a specific project.

properties.name: current_study_status
properties.description: The current status within the given study for the participant.

properties.name: quarter_enrolled
properties.description: The quarter and year in which the participant enrolled in the study (in the format of XXXXQX (e.g., 2020Q1 for year 2020, Quarter 1).

properties.name: role_in_project
properties.description: The participant's role in the project: either staff (e.g., Court Coordinator, Judge, Law Enforcement, Lawyer, Peer, Treatment) or  the client (i.e., the individual receiving the study's services/treatment)

properties.name: state_of_enrollment
properties.description: State where client was enrolled (e.g., state abbreviation such as IL,MO,etc)

properties.name: project.id
properties.description: Unique identifiers for records in the 'project' table that relate via this foreign key to records in this 'participant' table.

properties.name: participant.id
properties.description: A unique identifier for records in this 'participant' table.

properties.name: project.id
properties.description: Unique identifiers for records in the 'project' table that relate via this foreign key to records in this 'publication' table.

properties.name: publication.id
properties.description: A unique identifier for records in this 'publication' table.

nodes.name: reference_file
nodes.description: Data file containing any type of reference required for a data analysis.

properties.name: data_category
properties.description: Broad categorization of the contents of the data file.

properties.name: data_format
properties.description: Format of the data files.

properties.name: data_type
properties.description: Specific content type of the data file.

properties.name: date_file_updated
properties.description: Date the file was created from the indexd record with pattern yearmonthday (eg. 20200411 for April 11 2020)

properties.name: file_name
properties.description: The name (or part of a name) of a file (of any type).

properties.name: file_size
properties.description: The size of the data file (object) in bytes.

properties.name: md5sum
properties.description: The 128-bit hash value expressed as a 32 digit hexadecimal number used as a file's digital fingerprint.

properties.name: object_id
properties.description: The GUID of the object in the index service.

properties.name: project.id
properties.description: Unique identifiers for records in the 'project' table that relate via this foreign key to records in this 'reference_file' table.

properties.name: reference_file.id
properties.description: A unique identifier for records in this 'reference_file' table.

nodes.name: serious_adverse_event
nodes.description: The most up to date information pertaining to a single SAE.  For example, if an SAE is submitted and the a follow up form is submitted with more up to date information, this node will capture the most up to date information.

properties.name: gender
properties.description: Text designations that identify gender. Gender is described as the assemblage of properties that distinguish people on the basis of their societal roles. [Explanatory Comment 1: Identification of gender is based upon self-report and may come from a form, questionnaire, interview, etc.]

properties.name: hispanic
properties.description: Hispanic, Latino, or Spanish origin

properties.name: is_related_to_study
properties.description: Is this serious adverse event related to the study? Note,  "Possible" means: There is a reasonable possibility that  the incident, experience, or outcome may have been  caused by the procedures involved in the research.

properties.name: on_opioid_medication
properties.description: Was client taking a medication for opioid use disorder (MOUD)? This is derived from hubs who are are using MOUD intervention.

properties.name: quarter_of_sae
properties.description: The quarter and year in which serious adverse event was recorded XXXXqX (e.g., 2020q1 for year 2020, Quarter 1).

properties.name: race
properties.description: The racial identity of the participant.

properties.name: was_expected
properties.description: Expected or unexpected? Note, "Unexpected" means unexpected in nature, severity, or frequency given (a) the research procedures that are described in the project-related documents  and informed consent document and  (b) the characteristics of the population being studied.

properties.name: project.id
properties.description: Unique identifiers for records in the 'project' table that relate via this foreign key to records in this 'serious_adverse_event' table.

properties.name: serious_adverse_event.id
properties.description: A unique identifier for records in this 'serious_adverse_event' table.

nodes.name: demographic
nodes.description: Demographic data for reporting purposes. Taken from the baseline core measure data.

properties.name: gender
properties.description: The gender the participant identifies with. The core measures specify either item O2 or D4b can be used. If O2 used,  records are mapped onto D4b for reporting purposes.

properties.name: hispanic
properties.description: Hispanic, Latino, or Spanish origin

properties.name: race
properties.description: The racial identity of the participant.

properties.name: participant.id
properties.description: Unique identifiers for records in the 'participant' table that relate via this foreign key to records in this 'demographic' table.

properties.name: demographic.id
properties.description: A unique identifier for records in this 'demographic' table.

nodes.name: enrollment
nodes.description: Keeps track of the number of people enrolled in a study (i.e., **number of people with individual level data** and excluding studies providing only aggregate administrative data).> IMPORTANT: this node was created to allow the JDC homepage to specifically track the subset of participants with individual level data (ie data not synthetically created from marginal distributions)

properties.name: participant.id
properties.description: Unique identifiers for records in the 'participant' table that relate via this foreign key to records in this 'enrollment' table.

properties.name: enrollment.id
properties.description: A unique identifier for records in this 'enrollment' table.

nodes.name: time_point
nodes.description: Measures collected at multiple time points (baseline and follow ups)

properties.name: days_from_baseline_session
properties.description: Time interval from the date of assessment session to the first assessment session (ie baseline)

properties.name: shifted_visit_dt
properties.description: The visit date of a given time point which is shifted by a random fixed number of days (182 days before or after the actual date) within an individual.  The fixed (ie same shift amount within each individual), random shift provides date de-identification while retaining  the interval between these (de-identified) dates.

properties.name: version_data
properties.description: Version number of data

properties.name: visit_month
properties.description: The formatted name of the visit. This may Baseline or a month Follow-up (e.g., 1 month, 2 month...24 month). > Note, this does not correspond to the actual month of the visit.  Rather, it corresponds to the intended visit month. For example, if a study has a 3 month visit but the participant could not  come in until 4 months after baseline, this will still be called "3 month." To get an exact time since baseline, see `days_from_baseline_session`.

properties.name: visit_number
properties.description: Visit number representing the intended visit number as stated in the protocol.

properties.name: visit_type
properties.description: Define if the visit is a "Follow-up" or a "Baseline" visit (or Not applicable)

properties.name: participant.id
properties.description: Unique identifiers for records in the 'participant' table that relate via this foreign key to records in this 'time_point' table.

properties.name: time_point.id
properties.description: A unique identifier for records in this 'time_point' table.
